meanings.definition: To surpass in blazing or shining brightly.
meanings.sent1: The sun was outblazing all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display was outblazing all the other attractions at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight thought it was outblazing the sun, but everyone just laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was outblazing the neon lights of the city.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse was outblazing the storm, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outdo in terms of brightness or brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The diamond was outblazing all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent2: Her talent for singing was outblazing the competition at the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The firefly thought it was outblazing the moon, but it was just a tiny bug.
meanings.sent4: His intelligence was outblazing the rest of the students in the class.
meanings.sent5: The supernova was outblazing all the other stars in the galaxy.
